snippet: Martin Karplus, Michael Levitt and Arieh Warshel were recognized for computer simulations that enable closer study of complex reactions like photosynthesis and the design of new drugs.
abstract: Nobel Prize in Chemistry is awarded to Martin Karplus, Michael Levitt and Arieh Warshel, recognized for computer simulations that enable closer study of complex reactions like photosynthesis and design of new drugs; winning researchers are notable for work that does not involve test tubes or lab coats, but instead, explores world of molecules virtually, with computers.
lead_paragraph: Martin Karplus, Michael Levitt and Arieh Warshel were recognized for computer simulations that enable closer study of complex reactions like photosynthesis and the design of new drugs.

headline.main: Without Test Tubes, 3 Win Nobel in Chemistry
headline.print_headline: Without Test Tubes, 3 Win Nobel in Chemistry
